Introduction to Solid State Physics

  • Solid-state physics is the study of rigid matter, or solids, through methods such as quantum mechanics, crystallography, electromagnetism, and metallurgy.
  • It is the largest branch of condensed matter physics, even of all physical sciences. Solid-state physics studies how the large-scale properties of solid materials result from their atomic-scale properties.
  • Solid-state physics forms a theoretical basis of materials science. It also has direct applications, for example in the technology of transistors and semiconductors.
